usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script prompts user to 'Select a viewport' using _Viewport.sel(). Initializes a Drawing object linked to the viewport: Drawing dpDim(vp). Performs coordinate transformations from Model Space to Paper Space using vp.ms2psMatrix(). Includes user property 'Offset in paperspace units'.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: AutoCAD Layout (Paper Space) containing a Viewport of an element.

scriptPurpose.summary: Automates the dimensioning and annotation of openings (windows, doors, shafts) within timber wall or roof elements directly on 2D layout views.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Generating production drawings where precise dimensions of window cutouts (rough openings vs. timber trimmer sizes) and labels must be placed on elevation or plan views relative to a specific Viewport.

parameters.name: sSectionName
parameters.businessMeaning: Links this dimension script to a specific section or view script to ensure they analyze the same element or viewport context.
parameters.validRange: Names of existing TSL instances in the drawing
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines which element/viewport data is sourced for dimensioning.

parameters.name: genBeamFilterDefinition
parameters.businessMeaning: Specifies which structural beams to consider when calculating 'closest beam' dimensions (e.g., excluding sheathing or blocking).
parameters.affectsOutput: Changes the points where dimension lines terminate (e.g., measuring to the stud face vs. the sheathing face).

parameters.name: genBeamFilterDefinitionReference
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines which beams establish the 'zero point' or start of the dimension chain.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the start point of the dimension line (e.g., measuring from the start of the wall vs. a specific zone).

parameters.name: filterOpeningDescriptionsProp
parameters.businessMeaning: Filters openings so that only those matching a specific description (e.g., 'Window Type A') are dimensioned.
parameters.affectsOutput: Reduces clutter by dimensioning only specific subsets of openings.

parameters.name: sMode
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines the geometric boundary to measure. 'Outline' measures the rough opening size; 'Closest beams' measures the timber size (trimmer/jack); 'Shadow profile' measures the projection on complex surfaces.
parameters.validRange: Outline, Closest beams, Outside of closest beams, Shadow profile
parameters.affectsOutput: Fundamentally changes the dimension values displayed (rough opening vs. finished timber width).

parameters.name: sSheetInOpening
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if sheeting materials within the opening (e.g., structural sub-sills) are treated as boundary beams for dimensioning.
parameters.affectsOutput: Influences dimension points if sheets are present in the opening jambs.

parameters.name: sDimHeader / sDimTopPlate / sDimBottomPlate
parameters.businessMeaning: Toggles the inclusion of header, top plate, and bottom plate heights in the vertical dimension stack.
parameters.affectsOutput: Adds or removes vertical extension lines for plates in the dimension chain.

parameters.name: sPosition
parameters.businessMeaning: Sets the location of the dimension line relative to the element (e.g., below a plan view or beside an elevation). 'Vertical per opening' creates separate dims for each window.
parameters.validRange: Horizontal bottom/top, Vertical left/right, Vertical per opening
parameters.affectsOutput: Changes the rotation and placement of the dimension lines in the layout.

parameters.name: sUsePSUnits
parameters.businessMeaning: If 'Yes', the offset is treated as a fixed distance on the paper (independent of viewport scale). If 'No', it is a model space distance (scales with the view).
parameters.affectsOutput: Ensures dimension line spacing remains consistent across different viewport scales.

parameters.name: dDimLineOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: The distance between the element and the dimension line.
parameters.affectsOutput: Moves the dimension line closer to or further from the geometry.

parameters.name: sDimLayout
parameters.businessMeaning: Controls the style of dimensioning: 'Delta' shows individual segment sizes, 'Cumulative' shows total running distances, 'Both' combines them.
parameters.affectsOutput: Changes the density and type of dimension text/arrows displayed.

parameters.name: sDimensionSide
parameters.businessMeaning: Specifies which side of the opening the dimension markers snap to (Left, Right, Both, or Center).
parameters.affectsOutput: Moves the dimension arrows/lines to the specified jamb side.

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.businessMeaning: The text label to display next to the dimension (e.g., 'Window 01').
parameters.affectsOutput: Adds annotation text to the drawing.

parameters.name: sSideDescription
parameters.businessMeaning: Placement of the text label relative to the dimension line.
parameters.affectsOutput: Moves the label text to the left or right end of the dimension line.

parameters.name: sReferenceType
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines what anchors the start of the dimension chain (e.g., 'Zone' allows dimensioning relative to a specific grid or construction zone).
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the origin (0 value) of the dimension chain.

parameterDependencies.effect: dDimLineOffset is interpreted as PaperSpace units rather than ModelSpace units.
Beam filtering becomes active to determine which constitutes the 'closest' beam.
Requires a specific Zone selection to calculate the dimension start point.

parameterDependencies.trigger: sPosition is set to 'Vertical per opening'
parameterDependencies.effect: The script generates multiple individual dimension lines instead of one continuous chain, often prioritizing local opening details over global wall dimensions.

outputEntities.description: Linear dimensions indicating opening sizes, locations, and heights.
Custom description labels (e.g., Window names) positioned relative to the dimension line.

workflowDiagram: 1. Launch Script: User executes HSB_D-Opening.mcr.
2. Insertion Phase: Script prompts 'Select a viewport' on the command line.
3. Insertion Phase: Script prompts 'Select insertion point' for the TSL instance.
4. Initialization: Script stores the Viewport Handle to the instance map.
5. Recalculation Phase: Script retrieves the stored Viewport Handle and resolves the Viewport object.
6. Context Resolution: Script retrieves the Element linked to the Viewport.
7. Validation: Script checks if Viewport and Element are valid. Exits if not.
8. Filtering: Script collects GenBeams from the element and applies filters (Beamcode, Label, Material, Zone, Custom TSL).
9. Opening Detection: Script calculates the Netto profile (Brutto profile minus Beams) to identify openings.
10. Reference Calculation: Script determines the dimension start point (0.00) based on 'Reference Type' (Element bounds or specific Zone).
11. Loop: Iterate through all detected openings.
12.   Point Calculation: Calculate specific measurement points based on 'Mode' (Outline, Closest Beams, Shadow Profile).
13.   Side Selection: Filter points based on 'Dimension Side' (Left, Right, Center).
14.   Vertical Details: If position is Vertical, add Header/TopPlate/BottomPlate points if enabled.
15.   Branch Position:
16.     - If 'Vertical per opening': Draw individual dimension and label immediately for this opening.
17.     - If Global (Horizontal/Vertical): Add points to a master list for later drawing.
18. End Loop.
19. Finalization: If Global position, sort all collected points.
20. Drawing: Calculate final Dimension Line position (accounting for PaperSpace/ModelSpace offset).
21. Drawing: Draw the main Dimension object and Text label in Paper Space.

path1.name: Insertion
steps: Prompt user to select a Viewport.
Prompt user to select an insertion point.
Save Viewport Handle to entity properties.

path2.name: Recalculation
steps: Read Viewport Handle from entity properties.
Resolve Element from Viewport.
Proceed to geometry processing.

path1.name: Outline / Shadow Profile
steps: Calculate points directly from the element's Netto profile or Opening geometry.
Project points to the element side.

path2.name: Closest Beams
steps: Search for beams intersecting the opening bounding box.
If beams found, calculate intersection points.
If NO beams found, fallback to 'Outline' mode with a warning message.

path1.name: Vertical per opening
steps: Process openings one by one.
Create a unique dimension line for each opening immediately.
Do not add to the global point list.

path2.name: Horizontal / Vertical Global
steps: Collect all relevant points from all openings into a single list.
Sort points along the dimension axis.
Create a single continuous dimension line at the end of the script.

path1.name: No reference point
steps: Use the start of the element's bounding box as the dimension origin (0).

path2.name: Zone
steps: Filter beams based on the 'Reference zone' index.
Use the location of the first beam in that zone as the dimension origin.

validationRules.errorMessage: (Implicit exit - No error message shown, script simply stops)
validationRules.recovery: Ensure the selected viewport contains a valid hsbCAD Element.

validationRules.errorMessage: Script checks if arPtDim.length() < 3. If true, it exits without drawing.
validationRules.recovery: Check filters (Mode, BeamCode, etc.) to ensure they are not excluding all geometry. Ensure the element actually has openings.

validationRules.errorMessage: Message: '[ScriptName] - No beams found around opening. Outline is taken.'
validationRules.recovery: Adjust 'Filter definition for GenBeams' or 'Sheet in opening' settings, or ensure there are beams surrounding the opening.

postInsertionActions.effect: Updates which openings or beams are included in the dimension calculation (e.g., filtering by BeamCode or Label).
Switches dimension points between the rough opening outline and the closest timber beams.
Moves the dimension line closer/further from the model. Toggling 'Offset in paperspace units' locks the distance to the paper size rather than the model scale.
Reorients the dimension line from Horizontal to Vertical, or switches from a single chain to 'Vertical per opening'.

data.markdown:
# HSB_D-Opening.mcr ## Overview Automates the dimensioning and annotation of openings (windows, doors, shafts) within timber wall or roof elements directly on 2D layout views. It calculates dimensions based on rough openings or timber trimmer sizes and draws the results in Paper Space. ## Usage Environment | Space | Supported | Notes | |-------|-----------|-------| | Model Space | No | Script is intended for 2D documentation. | | Paper Space | Yes | Primary environment; requires a Viewport selection. | | Shop Drawing | Yes | Used to annotate production drawings. | ## Prerequisites - **Required Entities**: A Viewport in an AutoCAD Layout displaying an hsbCAD Element (Wall/Roof). - **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (Script detects openings in the element profile). - **Required Settings**: `HSB_G-FilterGenBeams.mcr` (Optional, used if custom beam filters are required). ## Usage Steps ### Step 1: Launch Script Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `HSB_D-Opening.mcr` from the list. ### Step 2: Select a Viewport ``` Command Line: Select a viewport Action: Click on the viewport border that displays the element you wish to dimension. ``` ### Step 3: Select Insertion Point ``` Command Line: Select insertion point Action: Click anywhere in the Paper Space layout to place the script instance. This point acts as the anchor for the script but does not necessarily dictate the dimension line location (which is controlled by properties). ``` ## Properties Panel Parameters | Parameter | Type | Default | Description | |-----------|------|---------|-------------| | **Selection** | | | | | Section tsl name | String | Empty | Links this dimension script to a specific section script to ensure they analyze the same element. | | Filter definition for GenBeams | Dropdown | Empty | Select a filter to define which structural beams are considered when calculating "closest beam" dimensions (e.g., ignoring sheathing). | | Filter beams with beamcode | String | Empty | Enter a beamcode to only include beams matching this code in the dimension calculation. | | Filter beams and sheets with label | String | Empty | Enter a label to only include entities with this label. | | Filter zones | String | Empty | Enter a zone number to restrict dimensioning to specific zones. | | Filter openings with description | String | Empty | Enter text to only dimension openings whose description matches this text. | | **Geometry & Mode** | | | | | Mode | Enum | Outline | **Outline**: Measures the rough opening size.
**Closest beams**: Measures to the face of the nearest timber beam (trimmer/jack).
**Shadow profile**: Measures the projection on complex surfaces. | | Sheet in opening | Enum | No | If "Yes", treats sheeting materials inside the opening as boundary beams for dimensioning. | | **Layout & Style** | | | | | Position | Enum | Horizontal bottom | Sets where the dimension line is placed (e.g., below the view, beside the view, or vertical for each opening). | | Offset in paperspace units | Enum | No | **Yes**: Offset is fixed on paper (ignores viewport scale).
**No**: Offset scales with the model (ModelSpace units). | | Dim line offset | Double | 300 | Distance between the element and the dimension line. | | Dim layout | Enum | Delta perpendicular | **Delta**: Shows individual segment sizes.
**Cumulative**: Shows total running distances.
**Both**: Combines styles. | | Dimension side | Enum | Left | Determines which side of the opening the dimension markers snap to (Left, Right, Both, or Center). | | **Reference & Origin** | | | | | Reference type | Enum | No reference point | **No reference point**: Starts dimensioning from the element start.
**Zone**: Uses the first beam of a specific zone as the zero point (0.00). | | Reference zone index | Int | 0 | Specifies the zone number to use as the reference origin (only if Reference Type is 'Zone'). | | **Annotation** | | | | | Description | String | Empty | The text label to display next to the dimension (e.g., "Window 01"). | | Side description | Enum | Left | Places the description text on the Left or Right side of the dimension line. | | **Vertical Dimensions** | | | | | Dim header | Enum | Yes | Includes the header height in the vertical dimension stack. | | Dim top plate | Enum | Yes | Includes the top plate height in the vertical dimension stack. | | Dim bottom plate | Enum | Yes | Includes the bottom plate height in the vertical dimension stack. | ## Right-Click Menu Options | Menu Item | Description | |-----------|-------------| | Recalculate | Updates the dimensions based on changes to the model or properties. | | Properties | Opens the Properties Palette to adjust the parameters listed above. | | Erase | Removes the script and all generated dimensions from the drawing. | ## Settings Files - **Filename**: `HSB_G-FilterGenBeams.mcr` - **Location**: TSL Catalog path - **Purpose**: Defines the filter lists available in the "Filter definition for GenBeams" dropdown. ## Tips - **Consistent Layouts**: Enable "Offset in paperspace units" if you have multiple viewports at different scales. This ensures the gap between the wall and the dimension line looks the same on paper for all views. - **Trimmer Dimensions**: To dimension the size of the timber trimmers (studs/jacks) around a window rather than the rough opening, set **Mode** to "Closest beams". - **Clutter Reduction**: Use "Filter openings with description" to dimension only specific types (e.g., only "Door" openings) while ignoring windows. - **Missing Dimensions**: If dimensions do not appear, check that your filters are not too restrictive (e.g., an incorrect Zone or Beamcode filter). The script will exit silently if it finds no valid geometry. ## FAQ - **Q: Why are my dimensions way too far away from the model?** - **A: Check the "Offset in paperspace units" property. If it is set to "No", the offset is in ModelSpace (mm). If it is "Yes", it is in PaperSpace (mm on paper). Switching between these can cause drastic changes in distance. - **Q: How do I dimension from a specific grid line or zone instead of the wall start?** - **A: Set **Reference type** to "Zone" and enter the specific zone index in "Reference zone index". The dimensions will start from the first beam found in that zone. - **Q: The script measures the rough opening, but I need the clear opening for the window.** - **A: Change the **Mode** property from "Outline" to "Closest beams". Ensure your beam filters allow the script to "see" the trimmer studs.
